pullRequest.body:
Lemmas about limsup and bddAbove needed for #15373.

---

GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message

- ...

nodes.body:
### PR summary [925ca95a13](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18172/commits/925ca95a13142c99bb3f7be26022d9322f038542)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ bddAbove_range_mul`
`+ eventually_add_neg_lt_of_le_liminf`
`+ eventually_lt_add_pos_of_limsup_le`
`+ exists_lt_of_le_liminf`
`+ exists_lt_of_limsup_le`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Sorry to bother you again, but I'm currently working on proving these lemmas ; I should have a more general version of `limsup_mul_le` with a much shorter proof (and many more similar lemmas). Would you mind waiting for a few days?

Is there anything you need for your project beyond `limsup_mul_le`? The coe lemmas look interesting.

> Sorry to bother you again, but I'm currently working on proving these lemmas ; I should have a more general version of `limsup_mul_le` with a much shorter proof (and many more similar lemmas). Would you mind waiting for a few days?
> 
> Is there anything you need for your project beyond `limsup_mul_le`? The coe lemmas look interesting.

When do you think you will have it ready?

These are all used in #15373. The coercion lemmas are only used in the proof of `Real.limsup_le` (so if you have a better proof, I probably will not need them), but the remaining lemmas are used in the file `Analysis/Normed/Ring/SmoothingSeminorm` in that PR, so I need to keep them.
Please remove the label again on Monday if no news

A more general version of `limsup_mul_le` is in [#18365](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18365) (arbitrary filters, and the nonnegativity/boundedness conditions are replaced by appropriate eventual/frequent properties). Your own version should follow quite quickly from it.

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#18365~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
Thanks, modulo a couple of golfing comments it LGTM.
Thanks, modulo a couple of golfing comments it LGTM.

This is true in much greater generality. The domain can be arbitrary, and I think the codomain only needs to have `Zero`, `Mul` and `PosMulMono` and `MulPosMono`, or something to that effect (e.g., `OrderedSemiring`), because you simply need to apply [mul_le_mul_of_nonneg](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Order/GroupWithZero/Unbundled.html#mul_le_mul_of_nonneg).

If you need things like this, I suggest duplicating the API around [BddAbove.mul](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Order/Group/Pointwise/Bounds.html#BddAbove.mul) with these alternative assumptions.
I have replaced the domain and codomain as suggested and moved the lemma to `Algebra.Order.Ring.Unbundled.Nonneg` (suggested by `find_home`, although it does not seem a great fit).

This is a weird statement. The `âˆ€á¶ ` can just be replaced with `âˆ€`, at which point this essentially becomes `(upperBounds (Set.range u)).Nonempty`, modulo some simplification. I don't really see the purpose of this.
Deleted.

```suggestion
/-- If `Filter.limsup u at_top â‰¤ x`, then for all `Îµ > 0`, eventually we have `u a < x + Îµ`.  -/
theorem eventually_lt_add_pos_of_limsup_le {Î± : Type _} [Preorder Î±] {x : â„} {u : Î± â†’ â„}
    (hu_bdd : IsBoundedUnder LE.le atTop u) (hu : Filter.limsup u atTop â‰¤ x) {Îµ : â„} (hÎµ : 0 < Îµ) :
    âˆ€á¶  a : Î± in atTop, u a < x + Îµ :=
```
1. we would also want the `liminf` version.
2. probably we should have this as an `iff` and then make an `alias`?
3. this is about `â„`-valued functions, why is it in `ENNReal`?

1. Done.
2. I don't see how to make it into an `iff` without adding the extra hypothesis `(hu_bdd : IsCoboundedUnder LE.le atTop u)`.
3. `Topology.Instances.Real` does not have all the required imports; this `ENNReal` file was probably suggested by `find_home`. I have moved this lemma and the following one to `Topology.Algebra.Order.LiminfLimsup` and replaced `â„` by a `ConditionallyCompleteLinearOrder`.

ditto
```suggestion
/-- If `Filter.limsup u at_top â‰¤ x`, then for all `Îµ > 0`, there exists a positive natural
  number `n` such that `u n < x + Îµ`.  -/
theorem exists_lt_of_limsup_le {x : â„} {u : â„• â†’ â„} (hu_bdd : IsBoundedUnder LE.le atTop u)
    (hu : Filter.limsup u atTop â‰¤ x) {Îµ : â„} (hÎµ : 0 < Îµ) : âˆƒ n : PNat, u n < x + Îµ := by
```
Same comments as above.
This is also a fairly strange statement. Where do you even use it or need it?
I have deleted this.

```suggestion
    {x Îµ : Î±} {u : Î² â†’ Î±} (hu_bdd : IsBoundedUnder LE.le atTop u) (hu : Filter.limsup u atTop â‰¤ x)
    (hÎµ : 0 < Îµ) :
```

```suggestion
    {x Îµ : Î±} {u : Î² â†’ Î±} (hu_bdd : IsBoundedUnder GE.ge atTop u) (hu : x â‰¤ Filter.liminf u atTop)
    (hÎµ : Îµ < 0) :
```

```suggestion
theorem exists_lt_of_limsup_le [AddMonoid Î±] [AddLeftStrictMono Î±] {x Îµ : Î±} {u : â„• â†’ Î±}
    (hu_bdd : IsBoundedUnder LE.le atTop u) (hu : Filter.limsup u atTop â‰¤ x) (hÎµ : 0 < Îµ) :
```

```suggestion
  simp only [eventually_atTop] at h
```

```suggestion
  simp only [eventually_atTop] at h
```

```suggestion
theorem exists_lt_of_le_liminf [AddMonoid Î±] [AddLeftStrictMono Î±] {x Îµ : Î±} {u : â„• â†’ Î±}
    (hu_bdd : IsBoundedUnder GE.ge atTop u) (hu : x â‰¤ Filter.liminf u atTop) (hÎµ : Îµ < 0) :
```

pullRequest.title: feat(Topology/EMetricSpace/Basic): add boundedness lemmas
